availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin F. Trabue (Barren County, Kentucky, physician)

body.p: Barren County, Kentucky, physician. Kentucky native. Married to Lelia Anderson Trabue in Mercer County, Kentucky, on June 12, 1855. Father of Henry B. Trabue, Kate Trabue, Helen C. Trabue, and Bura Trabue. Graduate of the University of Louisville. Physician in Barren County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Barren County in 1860. Elected member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Barren County in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, Glasgow, p. 1063.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mercer County Marriages, Film #000191862 , p.103 of microfilm.
U.S. School Catalogs, 1765-1935University of Louisville, p. 15.
